alert.note: Alert for Monroe Lower Keys (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Key West (Key West - The Florida Keys)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 30 at 9:25AM EDT by NWS Key West
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Lower Keys in Monroe County through 1015 AM EDT... At 924 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspout approximately 13 miles south of Marquesas Keys, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts and wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Key West, Big Coppitt Key, Boca Chica Channel Bridge, Boca Chica, Fleming Key, Key Haven, Geiger Key, Boca Grande Key, Sunset Key and Shark Key. This includes US 1 between mile markers 0 and 14. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EDT for Florida.
